value.html: Soit \(E\) un espace euclidien et \(f\in\mathcal{L}(E)\).

value.latex: Montrer~: $\mathrm{Ker} f = \Im f  \Rightarrow  f + f^* \in GL(E)$.
value.html: Montrer : \(\mathrm{Ker} f = \Im f \Rightarrow f + f^* \in GL(E)\).

value.latex:
Si $f(x) + f^*(x) = 0$ alors
$f(x) \in \Im f \cap \Im f^* = \Im f \cap (\mathrm{Ker} f)^\bot
                             = \Im f \cap (\Im f)^\bot$
donc $f(x) = f^*(x) = 0$ et
$x\in \mathrm{Ker} f \cap \mathrm{Ker} f^* = \mathrm{Ker} f \cap (\mathrm{Ker} f)^\bot$.
value.html: Si \(f(x) + f^*(x) = 0\) alors \(f(x) \in \Im f \cap \Im f^* = \Im f \cap (\mathrm{Ker} f)^\bot = \Im f \cap (\Im f)^\bot\) donc \(f(x) = f^*(x) = 0\) et \(x\in \mathrm{Ker} f \cap \mathrm{Ker} f^* = \mathrm{Ker} f \cap (\mathrm{Ker} f)^\bot\).

value.latex: Montrer la réciproque lorsque l'on a $f^2 = 0$.
value.html: Montrer la réciproque lorsque l’on a \(f^2 = 0\).

value.latex:
$f^2 = 0  \Rightarrow  \Im f \subset \mathrm{Ker} f$.\par
$f+f^* \in GL(E)  \Rightarrow  \Im f + \Im f^* = \Im f + (\mathrm{Ker} f)^\bot = E                  \Rightarrow  \dim \Im f \ge \dim \mathrm{Ker} f$.
value.html:
\(f^2 = 0 \Rightarrow \Im f \subset \mathrm{Ker} f\).

\(f+f^* \in GL(E) \Rightarrow \Im f + \Im f^* = \Im f + (\mathrm{Ker} f)^\bot = E \Rightarrow \dim \Im f \ge \dim \mathrm{Ker} f\).

preview: Soit \(E\) un espace euclidien et \(f\in\mathcal{L}(E)\).
